hanzi-su-wiki:
陥

Значения

Заманивать; захватывать; падать, впадать во что-либо; попадать; пасть (о крепости); недостаток, ошибка

Мнемоника

Сокращение. Человек, ногой попавший в расположенную у крепостной стены 阝 ловушку, выполненную в виде ступки 臼.

Варианты

陷

rtega_mnemonic:
陷陷RS
陥陥		submerge, sink, plunge, trap, collapse
  • slope 阝 falling in a pit 臽: plunge, collapse or sink
  • modf. 陷 → 陥 (臼 → 旧)
heisig_constituent: collapse, pinnacle, parthenon, acropolis, straight-jacket, bound up, olden times, old days, stick, sun, day
Keyword_KANJIDIC: collapse, fall into, cave in, fall (castle), slide into
Keyword_KANJIDIC_ru: коллапс, попадают в, прогибаться, осенью (замок), слайд в
koohiiStory1: The Pinnacle is actually bound up by supports from olden times. Eventually, they give out, and the whole thing starts to collapse.
koohiiStory2: The Pinnacle is supported by pilings which were bound up in olden times. One day when the bindings rot away, the whole thing will collapse. (tweaking dihutensoa´s story to work a little better for me).
kunYomi: おちい.る、おとしい.れる
jp_example_words: 欠陥(けっかん): defect, fault, deficiency
jp_readingExamples: 陥る (おちい.る), 陥れる (おとしい.れる)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: This building was a former prison until the cave in. You see, prisons aren't built very carefully, they just try to get them done fast enough to stuff people in there. So while you can tell this was once a building, it definitely isn't a prison anymore, since the whole thing caved in.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture the cave in in your mind. Can you see all the little prisoners and guards being squished as the building tumbles down around them? Oh no!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: You keep picturing the cave in and you see Genghis Khan (かん) climbing over the rubble. He's the one who took down this prison! And he's coming for your town next!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Genghis Khan is all about being smart and using better tactics. In this case, why fight a bunch of guards and prisoners when you can just cause a cave in and win immediately? The ol' Khan cave in, a classic war maneuver.
Ru_Meaning: collapse, fall into, cave in, fall (castle), slide into
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the former (旧) corner (⺈) on the hill (⻖) falls

Zhi
Name meaning
Nothing.
xiàn
вм. 陷
Radicals: 阝, 勹, 旧  (building, prison, former)
Meaning Mnemonic
This building was a former prison until the cave in. You see, prisons aren't built very carefully, they just try to get them done fast enough to stuff people in there. So while you can tell this was once a building, it definitely isn't a prison anymore, since the whole thing caved in.
Picture the cave in in your mind. Can you see all the little prisoners and guards being squished as the building tumbles down around them? Oh no!
Reading Mnemonic
You keep picturing the cave in and you see Genghis Khan (かん) climbing over the rubble. He's the one who took down this prison! And he's coming for your town next!
Genghis Khan is all about being smart and using better tactics. In this case, why fight a bunch of guards and prisoners when you can just cause a cave in and win immediately? The ol' Khan cave in, a classic war maneuver.
